department.dept_long_name: Committee on the Study of Religion

course.title: Contemporary Roman Catholic Theology
course.description: A survey of contemporary Roman Catholic theology that discusses issues in the interpretations of God, Jesus, and the church with reference to theological method. The broad spectrum of present-day Roman Catholic theology will be covered through an analysis of diverse theologians and approaches: existential, transcendental, liberationist, feminist, analytical, and hermeneutical.
course.notes: Expected to be given in 2015-16. Offered jointly with the Divinity School as 2479.
